There must be a way to get to a service's metadata given only the service's=
 URI.  To require modifying the URI to get the metadata could modify the se=
rvice, or even select a different service.  So, given only the service's UR=
L, you can either hit the service, and discard all the response except some=
 header like MetaData-URI: /some-resource/metadata, which would seem an unn=
ecessarily wasteful invocation of the service just to get that URI.  Or, yo=
u can pass some parameter in the request (as a header) specifying that you =
don't want to invoke the service, but only want to get its metadata (or, as=
 you suggest, a reference to the metadata).

I can't think of any other way=
 to get to the metadata given only the service's URI and without altering i=
t.
